result.markdown:
--- title: "Introduction to DPLYR with National Park Visitation Data (Solution)" date: "2024-02-26" categories: [dplyr, solution] #image: "https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/e/ed/US-Mexico_barrier_map.png" format: html code-overflow: wrap code-fold: show editor: visual df-print: kable R.options: warn: false code-tools: true execute: eval: true --- # Solution Download as R Script [Exercise Without Solutions](Intro-to-DPLYR-NP.qmd) ## Load National Park Visitation data ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} np_data <- read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/melaniewalsh/Neat-Datasets/main/1979-2020-National-Park-Visits-By-State.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE) ``` ::: View the np_data dataframe by clicking on the spreadsheet icon in the Global Environment ## Install tidyverse ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} install.packages("tidyverse") ``` ::: ## Load dplyr library ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(dplyr) ``` ::: ## Exercise 1 Select 2 columns from the data using a DPLYR function. Save this 2-column dataframe to the variable smaller_df. Make sure to use the pipe %>% operator! ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} smaller_df <- np_data %>% select(Year, RecreationVisits) head(smaller_df) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
| Year| RecreationVisits| |----:|----------------:| | 1979| 2787366| | 1980| 2779666| | 1981| 2997972| | 1982| 3572114| | 1983| 4124639| | 1984| 3734763|
::: ::: # Question: How does the number of visits to Washington national parks compare to another state? ## Exercise 2 Filter the dataframe for only values in the state of Washington and save to the variable wa_parks ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} wa_parks <- np_data %>% filter(State == "WA") head(wa_parks) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|ParkName |Region |State | Year| RecreationVisits| |:----------------|:------------|:-----|----:|----------------:| |Mount Rainier NP |Pacific West |WA | 1979| 1516703| |Mount Rainier NP |Pacific West |WA | 1980| 1268256| |Mount Rainier NP |Pacific West |WA | 1981| 1233671| |Mount Rainier NP |Pacific West |WA | 1982| 1007300| |Mount Rainier NP |Pacific West |WA | 1983| 1106306| |Mount Rainier NP |Pacific West |WA | 1984| 1152411|
::: ::: ## Exercise 3 Calculate the sum total of RecreationVisits to Washington by using summarize() on the smaller dataframe wa_parks ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} wa_parks %>% summarize(sum(RecreationVisits)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
| sum(RecreationVisits)| |---------------------:| | 188798152|
::: ::: # Exercise 4 Filter the dataframe for only values in another state (your choice) and save to a variable. Calculate the sum total of RecreationVisits to this state by using summarize(). ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ca_parks <- np_data %>% filter(State == "CA") ca_parks %>% summarize(sum(RecreationVisits)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
| sum(RecreationVisits)| |---------------------:| | 367814229|
::: ::: # Question: How do the number of visits to these 2 states compare to one another? ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} (wa_parks %>% summarize(sum(RecreationVisits))) - ca_parks %>% summarize(sum(RecreationVisits)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
| sum(RecreationVisits)| |---------------------:| | -179016077|
::: :::
